circumstances: Shortly after takeoff from Pittsburgh-Intl Airport, while climbing, the right engine failed. The pilot-in-command initiated a right turn and attempted to return to the airport when the airplane stalled and crashed in flames in a residential area located in Coraopolis, about three miles northeast of the airport. The aircraft was destroyed and both pilots were seriously injured. There were no injuries on the ground.
probable_cause:
Engine malfunction and stall during initial climb due to powerplant, fuel system, carburetor failure. The following contributing factors were reported:
- Fuel system, carburetor improperly installed, leakage, 
- Failed to follow approved procedures, 
- Improper operation of powerplant and powerplant controls,
- Attempted operation with known deficiencies in equipment, 
- Forced landing off airport on land, 
- Right engine not feathered, 
- Turned aircraft toward dead engine while returning to airport.
